articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: We dropped points at Pittodrie on Saturday but should have buried the home side in the first half and then our two January signings combined to produce a goal.  There were enough positive signs to have me relaxed ahead of last night’s game against Hibs. What’s more, we scored with a penalty kick awarded after [...]
articles.title: Enough with the self-fulfilling excuses for failure

articles.description: CELTIC two penalty-kick awards in the 2-1 win over Hibs at Easter Road were correct. Former Premiership referee Bobby Madden agreed with match official Nick Walsh and VAR assistant Andrew Dallas in the calls during a frantic confrontation in Edinburgh. The first came after a fourth-minute sickening clash of heads when defender Nectarious Trantis sent [...]
articles.title: ‘CLEAR’ AND ‘RECKLESS’: CELTIC AWARDS SPOT ON, INSISTS EX-REF

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS beamed with utter delight when he joined his players in celebrating the nerve-riddled 2-1 win over Hibs at Easter Road. The Hoops manager displayed his joy – and relief – as the champions restored their three-point advantage at the top of the Premiership courtesy of two penalty-kicks from new Bhoy Adam Idah. Rodgers [...]
articles.title: WATCH: JOY RODGERS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS was left almost breathless in the aftermath of Celtic’s dramatic 2-1 stoppage-time triumph over Hibs at Easter Road. The beaming Hoops boss joined in with his players as they acknowledged the travelling support following a tension-laden encounter in the capital. It took two expertly-despatched penalty-kicks –  one to the left and one to [...]
articles.title: ‘PLAYERS SHOWED A BIG HEART,’ RODGERS HAILS HOOPS

articles.description: EXACTLY 24 years ago today, Celtic suffered the most humiliating result in the club’s history. The miserable and sensational reverse also turned around the thinking at the Parkhead club that saw seismic changes in its wake. In another CQN EXCLUSIVE series, we look at the lead-up to the inexplicable Scottish Cup exit against Inverness Caley [...]

articles.description: EDSON BRAAFHEID featured in the 2010 World Cup Final – just six weeks after getting the boot from Celtic. Braafheid made only 12 appearances before the Hoops rejected the option of making his move permanent [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…EDSON BRAAFHEID?

The Irishman fully intends to alter that situation fairly emphatically as the Hoops go [...]
